docTitle.titlePart:
eCryptfs: An Enterprise-class Cryptographic Filesystem
for Linux

front.div:
Abstract
eCryptfs is a cryptographic filesystem for
Linux that stacks on top of existing filesys-
tems. It provides functionality similar to that
of GnuPG, only the process of encrypting and
decrypting the data is done transparently from
the perspective of the application. eCryptfs
leverages the recently introduced Linux ker-
nel keyring service, the kernel cryptographic
API, the Linux Pluggable Authentication Mod-
ules (PAM) framework, OpenSSL/GPGME,
the Trusted Platform Module (TPM), and the
GnuPG keyring in order to make the process
of key and authentication token management
seamless to the end user.
